content.rendered:
Welcome to the University of La Verne residence halls where the transformative La Verne Experience lives 24 hours a day in residential life. We are excited to have you on campus for the 2024-2025 academic year! This page contains important information for move-in day.  Please take the time to read the details thoroughly to ensure a smooth check-in experience.

If you have questions, please feel free to contact the Housing & Residential Life team for assistance. We look forward to your arrival and the opportunity to help you achieve more than you ever imagined through your very own La Verne Experience.

Room Assignment/Roommate Information

Roommate information will be provided by the beginning of August via student email.

Roommates

Once you have your roommate’s contact information, we encourage you to contact your roommate(s), to get acquainted and discuss what each of you will be bringing. You can use your roommate’s screen-name to message them through the housing application by copying and pasting the screen-name into the “To:” box when creating a new message. Please note that your roommates could change prior to move-in if not “confirmed” within your profile, but we try to minimize this as much as possible.

Check In Times/Locations 

MOVE IN DAY:  AUGUST 17, 2024 Schedule

CITRUS OAKS VISTA
8:00am 5th Floor C Building 4th Floor
10:00am 4th Floor E Building 3rd Floor
12:00pm 3rd Floor All other Buildings 2nd Floor
2:00pm 2nd Floor All other Buildings 1st Floor
  • Fall Student Athletes: Please check with your coach for your sport approved move-in day/time. Your meal plan will not be available until Saturday, August 17th at breakfast, so please plan accordingly or check with your coach regarding meals.
  • New Law Students: Check-in is yet to be determined at the Oaks Housing Office.
  • New International Students: Check-in is on Tuesday, August 13th between 9:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. at the Oaks Housing Office. If you will be arriving before or after this check-in time, please e-mail housing@laverne.edu to arrange your move-in day and time.
  • MOVE IN DAY will be on Saturday, August 17th. Wave times for check-in will be distributed in the information letter sent at the beginning of August. Students must follow their hall/floor designated time slot to avoid confusion and long lines. Students will not be allowed to check in until their scheduled check-in time. 

Late Check-Ins

If you are not able to move in on your designated date and time, you may do a Late Check-In at:

  • Oaks Housing Office: Monday August 19-Friday August 23 from 9am-5pm

What to Bring

Citrus Hall Checklist

Oaks Hall Checklist

Vista Hall Checklist

Move-In Day Parking

University parking permits will not be required on move-in day in university-owned parking lots. However, parking enforcement will be in effect for all other violations including parking on a Red Lane, in Disabled Spaces, or illegally on city streets.

Unloading Zones

Certain areas immediately adjacent to the residence halls are being designated as unloading zones . Please park in those areas only while unloading belongings. Once you have unloaded your vehicle, please relocate to other parking spaces or the parking structure near your hall. This will help ease move-in for all residents.

Vista & Citrus Residents:

Please use 3rd & C Street to enter as other entrances will be blocked off to control traffic. You will be directed to the parking structure.

 Oaks Residents:

Please use parking lot H near Oaks Hall to unload. You may enter from any nearby entrance.

Parking Permits

All residential students can obtain their FREE R-Resident parking permit beginning August 1st, 2024.  Students with cars who wish to park in campus lots should obtain a parking permit as soon as possible at http://laverne.thepermitstore.com.

Follow the instructions below to obtain your FREE R-Resident parking permit. Note: you must use FIREFOX. This process does not support other browsers.

  1. Log into your La Verne Portal
  2. On the left menu, select Student Resources
  3. Select Parking Passes
  4. Click on Add item
  5. Complete the required information requested
  6. PRINT your temporary parking permit to use until you receive your Orange R-Resident sticker permit in the mail.

With your R-Resident parking permit you can park in any University parking lot.

Meal Plans 

Meal plans will be active beginning Saturday, August 17th at breakfast. Simply present your student ID at The Spot Dining Hall to start using your meal plan. You may view your Housing Application on the La Verne Portal to check the meal plan you enrolled in. You may change your meal plan during the first two weeks of the semester or term. To change your meal plan, complete the Meal Plan Change Form available on the left menu under Residential Forms.

Did you know you can add additional Leo Bucks to your meal plan at ANY time? To add additional Leo Bucks, please contact Bon Appetit at (909) 448-4438 or by visiting The Spot Dining Hall reception area.
